name: Hotel de France et de Guise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I first stayed in this hotel while on our honeymoon back in 1991, so there was a measure of nostalgia in coming back after all this time.
reviews.title: Good option for Blois

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally placed if you want to spend some time in Blois. The town's centre is very compact and you can walk to just about anywhere you'd want to go in about 10 minutes. Having the view of the chateau is nice (but it would be better if they lit the chateau up properly at night!)
reviews.title: Excellent service!

reviews.text: The rooms are normal for an old French building, with lots of odd angles and strange layouts, partly caused by toilets and showers being added to rooms that were never intended to have them back in the 16th century. For me this just adds to the charm of the place.
reviews.title: Great value for the price

reviews.text: Breakfast is a croissant, a piece of baguette, jam & honey, fruit juice and a hot drink. It may not sound like much but it's pretty typical of a 2* hotel in France and is actually more than enough to set you up for the day. And the dining room is just such a nice place to eat in!
reviews.title: Nice small hotel

likes.liked: — The location of the hotel and the friendliness of the owners and staff.
likes.disliked: — The old phone in my room.

reviews.text: The downside of all this is the noise. The traffic kicks off fairly early in the morning (and if your neighbours are up and about early then you get to hear about it as well) so light sleepers might be advised to get a room without the chateau view.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel - a great find

likes.liked: — the location and friendliness of the staff

description: Annie, Jacky, their sons Pierre & Vincent and their team welcome you in their charming hotel, built in 1890.Exceptionnal location : downtown, in front of the Royal Castle of Blois, a few steps from restaurants and pedestrian streeets with shops.Free access wifi and free garage for bike.Good location to explore the Loire Valley : Chambord (19 km), Cheverny (15 km) , Chaumont (17km), Chenonceau (45km), Amboise and Clos Lucé(35km).
